keith321 , .001,.002,.003 and so on ARE indeed usually Rar files. 
Not all Rar archives starts with .rar but .001 is also a common Rar archive ending and even if it is in another format WinRar usually works with them too.
Simply right click on the the first file (in this case .001) and choose 'open with' then you choose WinRar and tick the box so it always open the files with that ending in WinRar.
